H3.text: what countries are in the euro dollar. Italy

A4.text: The 20 eurozone members are: Austria, Belgium, Croatia, Cyprus, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, and Spain.

A5.text: The euro is the sole currency of 20 EU member states: Austria, Belgium, Croatia, Cyprus, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, the Netherlands, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, and Spain.

A8.text: The largest economies in the eurozone are France and Germany, whose combined economic output accounts for almost half of the zone’s total.

A9.text: The eurozone comprises EU member states which have adopted the euro.

A10.text: Since then, the eurozone has increased to encompass 20 countries.
